metadata.Title: CVE-2021-40426 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the sphere.c start_read() functionality of Sound Exchange libsox 14.4.2 and master commit 42b3557e. A specially-crafted file can lead to a heap buffer overflow. An attacker can provide a malicious file to trigger this vulnerability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-40426` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsox-fmt-all - 14.4.2-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
libsox-fmt-alsa - 14.4.2-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
libsox-fmt-ao - 14.4.2-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
libsox-fmt-base - 14.4.2-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
libsox-fmt-mp3 - 14.4.2-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
libsox-fmt-oss - 14.4.2-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
libsox-fmt-pulse - 14.4.2-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
libsox3 - 14.4.2-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
sox - 14.4.2-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '14.4.2-3ubuntu0.18.04.2').
